Naan is a Punjabi leavened bread made with fine white flour and yogurt which ferments the dough and adds flavour. The dough is rapidly made, there’s no kneading, and is quickly shaped by hand.

For the Indian film, see Naan (film) . Naan, nan or khamiri is a leavened, oven-baked flatbread found in the cuisines of West, Central and South Asia.
